revised_title: Investigation on Mediterranean Kala Azar VIII\#x2014;Further Observations on Mediterranean Sandflies
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the sandflies of Malta, focusing on Phlebotomus perniciosus, which is the most common sandfly in the region. They found that this species is mainly an outdoor sandfly and feeds more readily on cows and dogs than humans. The study also investigated the breeding habits and feeding behavior of P. perniciosus, which plays a significant role in the transmission of diseases like sandfly fever and Kala Azar.
